oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: Different customs concerning the eating of the Porcupine. (L VII.
6594 rev.). Certain persons not allowed to eat the tail of the Porcupine. (L VIII.
7409, 7408 rev. and 7409 rev.). A part of the Porcupine is used to prevent the evil consequences of eating !kùï. (L VIII.
16. 7450 rev., note). A story describing the habits of porcupines and the eating of them. The porcupine seeks food away from its hole and returns to a different hole.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Habits of porcupines
